benchmark_details.name: HuAMR
benchmark_details.overview: HuAMR is the first Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) dataset for Hungarian, providing a valuable resource for semantic parsing research in non-English languages. It includes manually refined silver-standard AMR annotations generated using Llama-3.1-70B.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a Hungarian AMR dataset that enhances semantic parsing capabilities for the Hungarian language.

data.source: Translated from AMR 3.0 dataset and generated silver-standard annotations.
data.size: 40,000 instances for training, 3,811 instances for testing
data.annotation: Automatically generated AMR graphs, refined manually for quality.

methodology.calculation: Smatch scores are calculated based on the overlap of matched triples between AMR graphs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Smatch scores indicate better performance in semantic parsing accuracy.
methodology.validation: Evaluated the generated graphs against PropBank frame argument descriptions.
